revised_title: Anatomical and Optical Structure of Animal Crystalline Lenses
tldr: The author examines the structure and properties of the crystalline lenses in animals, particularly in cod, using new methods of observation. They discover that the lens is made up of transparent, flat fibers that converge to a single focus. The author also investigates the way these fibers are laterally united to form a continuous spherical surface and measures the diameter of the fibers. This research contributes to the understanding of the anatomy and function of the eye.
